clinical_study.brief_title: tDCS Effects on Associative Learning in Younger Adults
clinical_study.official_title: Effects of Transcranial Direct Current Stimulation (tDCS) on Associative Learning in Young Adults

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of this study is to investigate whether a tDCS-accompanied training of audio-visual associative memory leads to a performance improvement in healthy older individuals."

primary_outcome.measure: Performance in a verbal associative learning paradigm under anodal tDCS compared to sham tDCS.
primary_outcome.time_frame: assessed immediately after training period (several learning blocks) compared to sham
primary_outcome.description: Investigation whether anodal tDCS leads to improved performance accuracy in the Wernicko task compared to sham stimulation.

secondary_outcome.description: Connectivity as measured by resting-state fMRI during baseline as predictors for performance and tDCS responsiveness
Microstructure of white matter (Fractional Anisotropy) as measured by diffusion tensor imaging during baseline as predictors for performance and tDCS responsiveness
To assess predictors of positive reaction to brain stimulation, genotyping of several learning related polymorphisms will be performed

secondary_outcome.time_frame: assessed directly before and immediately after tDCS + training compared to sham
secondary_outcome.description: Digit span forward performance assessed before and after stimulation to test for tDCS effects on attention

secondary_outcome.measure: Other cognitive outcomes: working memory performance
secondary_outcome.time_frame: assessed directly before and immediately after tDCS + training compared to sham
secondary_outcome.description: Digit span backward performance assessed before and after stimulation to test for tDCS effects on working memory

arm_group.description: Combination of intensive training of picture-word associations (Wernicko task) with anodal stimulation
Combination of intensive training of picture-word associations (Wernicko task) with sham stimulation

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Age: young (18-30 years)
- Right handedness
- unobtrusive neuropsychological screening
Exclusion Criteria:
- Mild cognitive impairment (MCI) or other neurological diseases.
- History of severe alcoholism or use of drugs.
- Severe psychiatric disorders such as depression, psychosis (if not in remission) and severe untreated medical problems.
- Contraindication for MRI (claustrophobia, metallic implants, ferromagnetic metals in the body, disorders of thermoregulation, pregnant women).
